intro: Orthilia secunda var. elatior, commonly known as the greater orthilia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
